description:
a /images/detail request shows machine image, ramdisk, and kernel images.  IMHO, it should be filtered to show only images where type is "machine".

In addition, given a machine image, the kernel and ramdisk images are part of the image metadata, so I wonder if the os_krm_mapping_file is necessary, or if it could be derived from the existing image metadata, eliminating a hand-maintained config file.

This is against ~bzr597.
title: openstack api should filter image types

comments.content:
Hi!

Actually, the image_type column is going to be replaced with a disk_format and appliance_format column in (very) early Cactus release, and filtering of the images by both columns is also slated:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/api-image-format
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/api-results-filtering

I'd love to get your input on the disk_format and appliance_format values that have been proposed so far. Feel free to comment here or on the mailing list!

Cheers!
jay

comments.content: Is this really a reasonable operation to impose on Nova? This bugs seems to only apply to ami-style images. There are plenty of self-contained image formats that this does not apply to.
